8f4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Tal is a product manager on the Chrome for Android team. Prior to joining the Chrome team, she worked on Google Apps and Local Search. She earned her bachelors degree in Neurobiology with a secondary focus in Computer Science at Harvard.

924b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Noah Falstein
924b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Noah Falstein has been a professional game developer since 1980 (Sinistar, Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis, Neuroracer), and was one of the first ten employees at LucasArts Entertainment, The 3DO Company, and Dreamworks Interactive.  He headed The Inspiracy, a game consultancy, and was the first elected Chairman of the IGDA, and design columnist for Game Developer magazine for 6 years.  At Google, Falstein contributes to game projects across the company, and engages with game developers as part of the Developer Advocacy team

92577170-b6f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Gus Gostyla
92577170-b6f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Gus looks after the VC & Startup ecosystem on behalf of Google Play. He joined Google after running BD for startups like Flipboard and Inkling where he built large publishing partner ecosystems and mobile distribution deals with Samsung, Amazon, and Microsoft. After starting his career as an editor at the Red Herring magazine, he helped build 3 more startups before joining Microsoft to help launch Xbox 360 and Windows Phone where he looked after social networking, games, and mobile partnerships. Gus is a graduate of Middlebury College and the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth.

93720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kaz Sato
93720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Kaz Sato is Staff Developer Advocate at Cloud Platform team, Google Inc. He leads the developer advocacy team for Machine Learning and Data Analytics products, such as TensorFlow, Vision API and BigQuery. Kaz also has been leading and supporting developer communities for Google Cloud for over 7 years. He is interested in hardwares and IoT, and has been hosting FPGA meetups as a personal project.

964dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Addy Osmani
964dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Addy Osmani is a Staff engineer working with the Chrome team on apps, libraries and tools for developer productivity. He currently leads up efforts like the Progress libraries and Polymer Starter Kit and has previously worked on projects like Material Design Lite, Yeoman and the Chrome DevTools. Addy has also written books such as Learning JavaScript Design Patterns and has a regular show called Totally Tooling Tips with co-presenter Matt Gaunt.

98582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Seth Thompson
98582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Seth Thompson is the product manager of the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine and the upcoming WebAssembly runtime. He is passionate about empowering developers with great tools, expressive languages, and productive open source communities.

999cfff9-9cfa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Carter Morgan
999cfff9-9cfa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Carter Morgan is a Developer Platforms Engineer at Google, where he gets to write code and give talks about his favorite tools -- Go and Kubernetes. Before Google, Carter was a programer for the United States Air Force and for Microsoft.  In his free time, he does standup comedy and teaches "Presenting with Charisma" to other Googlers.  When he’s not writing code or making people laugh, you can find him on twitter @_askcarter.

9a4b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kat Fang
9a4b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Kat is a software engineer on the Firebase team, working on a range of projects from the iOS clients to the realtime database to keeping the servers humming along. 

She graduated from MIT with a bachelor's and master's degree in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. Outside of work, she enjoys dancing, robotics, board games, and adventures.

9a720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Taylor Savage
9a720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Taylor is the Product Manager of the Polymer project and Google's web platform developer libraries. Prior to joining the Polymer team, Taylor worked on creating new front-end features on the Google Search page.

9aba67d4-b4f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Alex Sieke
9aba67d4-b4f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Alex is a Product Manager at Google focused on mobile web payments. Prior to joining Google, he worked as a web developer and product manager in the mobile commerce industry specializing in checkout optimization.  Alex earned a bachelor’s degree in economics and computer science from Princeton University.

9fedbd57-9efa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Bret McGowen
9fedbd57-9efa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Bret is on the Google Cloud Platform team at Google, focusing on developer-oriented products like App Engine, Compute Engine, the Cloud Vision API, Firebase and more. He's currently an aspiring Node.js developer. Prior to Google, Bret came from Texas, having worked in the cloud industry at Rackspace as a software engineer building the RackConnect hybrid hosting product. Before that, he led engineering teams at e-commerce, non-profit and startup companies. He's often on the running trail, volleyball court or kickball field.

Bret earned a bachelor’s degree in computer science from Texas A&M University.

a51e44dd-83f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Matt Bridges
a51e44dd-83f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Matt is a Technical Lead on the Mobile Vision project, working on clients and APIs.  Prior to Mobile Vision, Matt worked on Google Goggles and Search Infrastructure.   Matt earned a PhD in Computer Science from Princeton, focusing on automatic multithreading.

a67b77da-0def-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: J. Eason
a67b77da-0def-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Jamal Eason is a product manager for Android developer tools & products at Google. He is responsible for setting the product roadmap and features that help Android developers make great apps.  Prior to Google, he worked on developer tools at Intel, worked as product manager at a mobile app startup, and was a telecommunications officer in the US Army.

Jamal earned a bachelor's degree in computer science from the US Military Academy (West Point), a master’s degree from UMUC, and a MBA from Harvard Business School.

a70cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jennifer Gove
a70cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jenny Gove is a User Experience Researcher at Google, where she conducts research on the use of mobile devices. Currently Managing an Ads UX research team, she has also managed the Apps research team in her 10 years at Google. Previously she held UX roles at Sun Microsystems and start­up, Zadu. In her spare time Jenny mentors for 500 Startups. Jenny started her career in academia, as a Lecturer at the Open University, UK. She received her Ph.D. from the University of Southampton in the UK.

a942167a-3ef5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kellee Santiago
a942167a-3ef5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Kellee Santiago works with game developers to bring unique experiences to Google's VR platforms. As former president and co-founder of thatgamecompany, Kellee developed one of the most prominent brands in independent and innovative game development, pushing the communicative possibilities of video games as a medium. She speaks around the world at video game business and entertainment conferences on innovation in games, entrepreneurship, games as art and better methods for video game development. In 2010, she became a TED Fellow and was recognized as one of The Ten Most Influential Women in Games of the Past Decade.

aa720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: John Schlemmer
aa720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: John leads the motion efforts for the Material Design team and authored the new Animation chapter seen in the Material Design guidelines. He also led motion for Google apps like Inbox by Gmail, Google Calendar and Gmail. Before Google, John worked at Chicago-based agencies Razorfish and Design Kitchen doing broadcast and web-based motion graphics for clients like Motorola, Samsung, Target and Kraft. John earned a bachelor's degree in interactive media design with an emphasis on animation at the Illinois Institute of Art.

ab4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Wayne Piekarski
ab4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Wayne Piekarski is a Developer Advocate at Google, focusing on Android, Wear, and the Internet of Things. He has worked for 15 years in academia and industry in the areas of wearable computing, outdoor augmented reality, 3D user interfaces, and mobile devices, with a PhD from the University of South Australia. Wayne works to get developers excited about new mobile and wearable technologies, through conferences, social media, and training materials. He also works to advocate for developers within Google, ensuring developers have the right tools and information to support their work.

ae08866e-7ef3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ram Parameswaran
ae08866e-7ef3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ram is a developer programs engineer on the Google Mobile Ads developer relations team. In this role, his recent areas of focus include support for the Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin, and rewarded video mediation. Ram earned a bachelor's degree in software engineering from Carleton University at Ottawa.

ae0cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ilya Grigorik
ae0cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ilya Grigorik is a web performance engineer at Google, co-chair of the W3C Web Performance Working group, and author of High Performance Browser Networking (O'Reilly) book. In short, an internet plumber.

b1720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Fabian Schlup
b1720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Fabian is an engineer and technical lead on App Indexing. He has worked on APIs and developer products at Google for the last six years, including as a technical lead for the Google+ Platform and Google Calendar APIs. Fabian holds a Masters in Computer Science from the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology (ETH).

b50cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kirill Grouchnikov
b50cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: I am a user interface engineer. I have been doing client side development professionally since 1999 in a variety of UI toolkits and libraries that spanned Motif, MFC, VB, Ada, Delphi, Swing and SWT. Since late 2009 I work at Google on the Android team.

b5c5bf13-3bf8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ashish Sharma
b5c5bf13-3bf8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ashish Sharma leads the Volta Team in Android that makes batteries last longer. Previously at Google, he developed the per-application tracking and controls for network data in Android, and also worked on the Google Cloud Messaging infrastructure. In his spare time, he enjoys hiking, meditation, and riding his motorcycle. Ashish earned a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of California, Santa Barbara.

ba4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Adam Powell
ba4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Adam has been a member of the Android framework team since 2009 working on UI, lifecycle management, support libraries and more. He enjoys helping developers build great experiences that connect people to the world around them.

bc0cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Chet Haase
bc0cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Chet is the lead of the Android UI Toolkit team at Google, where he works on graphics, animation, widgets, and anything else that puts pixels on the screen.
He's been known to write and perform comedy and also to speak at developer conferences like this one.

bd6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Brad Abrams
bd6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Brad Abrams is Group Product Manager on the Google Cloud Platform team where he is responsible for the developer experiences on the platform. Software development is one of the last areas of modern life not deeply enhanced by the cloud - Brad’s mission is to bring the power, scale and availability of the modern cloud to the art of software development.  
Prior to Google, Brad lead many developer efforts at Microsoft on products including the .NET Framework, ASP.NET, Silverlight and Visual Studio.   Brad published several books include the bestselling Framework Design Guidelines.

be582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Malte Ubl
be582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Malte Ubl is the tech lead of the AMP Project. He previously spent 5 years at Google making JavaScript based apps go fast and in his free time, he is one of the co-organizers of JSConf EU.

bee1a8af-9dfa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jordan Tigani
bee1a8af-9dfa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jordan is one of the original engineers working on Google BigQuery, and has written a book on the subject. In 2014, he used Google Cloud tools to predict 14 of 16 matches correctly in the FIFA World Cup. Prior to joining Google, Jordan worked at several startups, which ranged from building mobile social apps to web security to machine learning-based advertising. Jordan has a Bachelor's degree from Harvard University and a Master's from University of Washington.

c14dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ellie Powers
c14dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ellie Powers leads product management for developers on Google Play, enabling them build to successful global businesses and high-quality, innovative apps. Prior to Google, Ellie has built products at large companies and startups in California, Paris, and London. She has a degree in computer science from MIT and was voted funniest person in Silicon Valley in 2016.

c2d5429b-9ef6-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Fontaine Foxworth
c2d5429b-9ef6-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Fontaine is a Product Manager focusing on mobile app analytics. Under this umbrella she has worked on features to expand install attribution, publisher reporting, and in-app activity.  Prior to Google she worked as a Product Manager at ModCloth, an eCommerce company. There she was a daily practitioner of Google Analytics while she built a mobile website as well as iOS and Android apps.  She has a BS in Civil Engineering from Stanford University.

c94dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Dominic Preuss
c94dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Dominic is the product lead for storage and databases on Google Cloud Platform. He is in his second stint with Google where he was previously the product manager for local advertising in Adwords from 2004-2007. In between, Dominic was the Chief Product & Technology Officer at SecondMarket and worked at several other startups in New York City. Dominic holds a Bachelor of Science in Engineering (BSE) degree in Biomedical Engineering from Duke University.

ca19ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ankur Kotwal
ca19ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ankur is a Developer Advocate experienced in building on Android and the Google Maps APIs. Based out of Sydney Australia, Ankur leads the Geo Developer Relations & Next Billion Users Developer Relations team to inspire developers towards building on the Google developer platform. Ankur is also a founding member and software engineer for Google Santa Tracker on Android.

cb911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Matteo Vallone
cb911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Matteo Vallone is a business development manager at Google Play in London. In his role, he helps apps and games businesses to find success on Android and Google Play. Matteo joined Google 8 years ago as a member of the YouTube strategy team and then worked as a product manager for YouTube, prior to joining Google Play 2 years ago. Before Google, Matteo worked as a consultant for Bain & Company.

cd6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Noor Ali-Hasan
cd6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Noor is a senior user experience researcher at Google, where she has focused on understanding user behavior and needs around various consumer products including the Android smartphone experience, Google Now, and Chromecast.  Prior to Google, Noor's research focused on interactive and smart TV products at Microsoft and Samsung Electronics. Noor holds a masters degree in Human-Computer Interaction from the University of Michigan.

cf2ac2bf-b4f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Rouslan Solomakhin
cf2ac2bf-b4f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Rouslan is a Chrome software engineer. He works on payments and spellcheck. Prior to Google, Rouslan worked on cloud platforms and full disk encryption suites. Rouslan earned a bachelor's degree in computer science with a minor in software engineering from Clarkson University and a master’s degree in computer science from Dartmouth College.

d119ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ian Lake
d119ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ian Lake is a developer advocate focused on the Android framework and the Android Support Library, although you'll always find him with at least a few wearable devices on. Prior to Google, he worked as an Android developer at Facebook and Phunware. Ian received his Masters in Computer Science from the University of Southern California and a Bachelors of Science in Computer Science and a Bachelors of Science in Physics from Montana State University.

d30cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kai Haley
d30cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Kai Haley is a UX designer leading the Design Relations team at Google. She is one of the lead trainers for Sprint Master Academy and has spent the last 2 years training over 200 Sprint Masters across Google’s diverse product areas. She is passionate about design thinking and inspiring the UX community to effectively utilize Design Sprints for speed and innovation. Her UX expertise has been centered on creating monetization opportunities, most recently on the Search Ads Team, and prior to Google, on the Yahoo! Front Page. She earned a Masters Degree in Design from CCA, where she focused on sustainable design.

d74b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Steve Ganem
d74b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Steve is a Product Manager of Google Analytics, overseeing the SDK and its integrations with other Google products and services.  Prior to Google, Steve spent 19 years in the video game industry, starting with Virgin Interactive (EA) and Neversoft (Activision), where he was the lead tools and online engineer for Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3, 4 and Underground.  He then went on to found SuperVillain Studios - an independent studio in Southern California - where he served as CTO and CEO for 11 years.  Steve earned a bachelor's degree in Information and Computer Science from the University of California at Irvine.

db0cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Todd Hansen
db0cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Todd has been working on Google Cloud Messaging for the past seven years focusing on performance, reliability, and scalability. Before Google, Todd helped build a county scale high performance wireless network while working for the San Diego Supercomputer Center. He earned both a masters degree in Geophysics and a bachelors in Computer Science from UCSD. He enjoys spending time with his family, hiking, woodworking, and amateur radio.

dc6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Julie Aranda
dc6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Julie is a senior UX researcher at Google, focusing on understanding user behaviors on mobile products.  She has been leading ethnographic research efforts on topics such as Accessibility and Notifications. Prior to Google, Julie conducted user research at eBay, Yahoo!, Palm, and LeapFrog.  Julie holds a Bachelor's degree from UC Berkeley and a PhD in Psychology from the University of Oregon.

de1387d5-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Meghan Desai
de1387d5-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Meghan Desai is a Product Manager at Google working on Android framework battery and memory management features. He has previously worked on Google’s Big Data platform. He is passionate about building products that are simple, seamless, and intuitive to use. An engineer at heart, Meghan enjoys building Android apps, tinkering with microcontrollers, and studying oenology. He has a BS in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Cornell University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

de4b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Matt Gaunt
de4b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Matt Gaunt,
Senior Developer Programs Engineer

Matt is currently spending his days working on the open web, helping developers and representing their needs to the engineers working on Chrome (he's super excited about push notifications and offline support for web apps). Before working on Chrome he helped with the launch of Google TV and Chromecast in Europe and prior to Google Matt was busy building native mobile applications.

e25bafd6-14ef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Carrie Rowe
e25bafd6-14ef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Carrie manages Early Access Programs for Google and is a Program Manager with Developer Relations. She has been with Google for six years and enjoys helping make developers successful on Google Platforms. Carrie earned a bachelor degree in finance from New York University.

e64b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Nicolas Geoffray
e64b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Nicolas Geoffray is a software engineer working on the ART project. He is responsible for the new optimizing compiler introduced in Android Marshmallow, and its transition to JIT for the upcoming N release. Before ART, he helped shape the Dart language and its efficient translation to JavaScript.

e805fd81-33f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Steve Malkos
e805fd81-33f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Mr. Malkos is the Technical Program Manager in the Android Location and Context Group at Google.  He manages all engineering aspects for Android’s Location and Context programs.  Mr. Malkos is responsible for defining these initiatives within Google which includes everything from GPS, Fused Location Provider (FLP), Android Sensor Hub, Sensors, and more.  Mr. Malkos has been involved in the field of location now for over 13 years.  Prior to his role at Google, he worked as an Associate Program Management Director at Broadcom, where he managed engineering teams within Broadcom’s GNSS software.   He holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Purdue University, currently holds 8 patents and has many more pending patents in the field of location.

e9911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ben Weiss
e9911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Ben is a Developer Programs Engineer on the Android Developer Relations team. He focuses on making Android apps more delightful.

Ben works within the Android ecosystem since 2009, being driving force behind several Android applications.
He also organized the GDG Berlin Android, was an Android GDE and established a Guinness World Record.

eb6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Marc Bächinger
eb6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: As a Developer Advocate for media Marc works with large media partners to help them being successful on the Google platform. Marc worked with many video apps to help them to adopt ExoPlayer for their application. Prior to Google Marc was a Software Architect and Engineering Consultant since almost two decades. He once earned a degree in Sociology and Economic History at the University of Zürich with a focus on macro economical innovation theories.

ee72244c-11f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Mathieu Chartier
ee72244c-11f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Mathieu Chartier is one of the engineers working on ART and wrote a large portion of the ART GC that has been in use since Lollipop. Prior to Google, Mathieu earned a bachelor's degree in computer science from the University of Waterloo.

f019ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Johnny Lee
f019ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Johnny Lee is the lead of Project Tango at Google - which is a focused effort to bring computer vision and advanced sensor fusion to mobile platforms. Previously, he helped Google X explore new projects as Rapid Evaluator and was a core algorithms contributor to the original Xbox Kinect. His YouTube videos demonstrating Wii remote hacks have surpassed over 15 million views and became one of the most popular TED talk videos. In 2008, he received his PhD in Human-Computer Interaction from Carnegie Mellon University and has been recognized in MIT Technology Review’s TR35.

f1911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jacob Wenger
f1911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jacob helps build extraordinary experiences for developers as a software engineer on the Firebase team. He has worked on many different parts of Firebase and is an active contributor to many of Firebase's open source libraries, including ReactFire and GeoFire. Jacob has been with Firebase since its startup days and was previously a developer on the Internet Explorer team at Microsoft. He graduated with a computer science degree from the University of Notre Dame.

f4dbcfd4-23fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Siva Velusamy
f4dbcfd4-23fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Siva is a software engineer in the Android Studio team. Prior to Google, he wrote embedded software and tools at Xilinx Inc. He holds a Masters degree in Computer Science from the University of Virginia.

f51387d5-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Monica Dinculescu
f51387d5-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Monica works on the Polymer Elements team, making pretty and accessible widgets for everyone to use. Before this, she worked on Chrome for two years, so she’s pretty sure she has at least once broken the Internet for you.

f6a4176d-11f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Calin Juravle
f6a4176d-11f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Calin Juravle is a member of the Android Runtime Team.
Prior to joining Google Calin was a senior engineer at GreenClouds responsible for the cloud provisioning and a co-founder in a startup engaged in providing corporate management solutions. Calin earned his MSc cum laude from Utrecht University, dedicating his research on programming languages and compilers; contributing to Utrecht Haskell Compiler and prototyping automatic GPU parallelization for VectorFabrics. As a valedictorian, Calin’s passion in Computer Science unveiled from his BSc at University Alexandru Ioan Cuza of Iasi, Romania.

f719ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Pete LePage
f719ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Pete helps web developers to build the next generation of web apps. As a Developer Advocate working on the web team, he likes taking the sharp edges off bleeding edge technologies and making it easy for developers to use them. Pete helped to create Web Fundamentals, Google’s resource for best practice web development, he hosts the New in Chrome video series on YouTube and has taught two Udacity courses, The Fundamentals of Responsive Web Design and Your First Progressive Web App.

f80cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Felipe Hoffa
f80cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: In 2011 Felipe Hoffa moved from Chile to San Francisco to join Google as a Software Engineer. Since 2013 he's been a Developer Advocate on big data - to inspire developers around the world to leverage the Google Cloud Platform tools to analyze and understand their data in ways they could never before. You can find him in several YouTube videos, blog posts, and conferences around the world.

fa6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Paul Bakaus
fa6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Paul Bakaus is a Developer Advocate at Google, heading up advocacy and outreach for DevTools, AMP and Games. He assists developers, designers, and filmmakers to create better, faster, more immersive and more convincing digital experiences. Prior to joining Google, he created the popular UI library jQuery UI, now being used by over 14% of the popular web. Paul also created the Aves Engine, the worlds first prototype of a fully interactive HTML5 game engine - which he ultimately sold to Zynga.

ff50e0f9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Paul McCartney
ff50e0f9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Paul is a software engineer with Google’s machine perception group.  In his role, he focuses on applying image and video understanding techniques to products and APIs.  Prior to Google, Paul was a key contributor in conceiving and deploying the U.S. Army’s Command Post of the Future system, which provides information visualization and collaboration capabilities for mission critical environments.  

Paul earned a doctorate in computer science from Washington University.  He also attended Carnegie Mellon University, where he received a bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, and cognitive science.
